chargeHist.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jay Patrick Flaherty was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jay Patrick Flaherty is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jay Patrick Flaherty was found guilty of 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "B" Felony], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child

supervisions.notes:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.
-Defendant is remanded into the custody of St. Croix County Sheriff's Department for transportation to Dodge Correctional.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

superMiscConds.notes: Restitution if any to be determined within 60 days and paid through DOC.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF418.

-Defendant is ordered to have a Sexual Deviancy Assessment/Treatment and follow through with all recommendations and continue as long as needed.
-Defendant is ordered to register with the Sex Offender Registry.
-Absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, C.C.H. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with any minors under the age of 18 years.
-Defendant is ordered to supervised visits with M.F. and J. F.
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF418.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY: James Robert Bartholomew, DF: Jay Patrick Flaherty appeared from jail.  Court called at 9:36 a.m. Set SEH.  Attorneys have reviewed the PSI.  Court has reviewed statement by Victim filed on 06/03/2015.  Victim is not present in the court.  Victim's mother A. Cooper makes statement.  J. Ellefson makes statement.  ADA Sortedahl recites the agreement and states argument.  Attorney Bartholomew makes statement and argument for sentencing.  DE makes statement to the court.  Court orders:

- DE is sentenced to 16 years I/C and 10 years E/S
- Credit for 278 days for credit served and attorneys will file a stipulation
- DE is ordered to a sexual deviancy assessment/treatment and follow through with all recommendations to continue as long as needed.
- DE is ordered to register with the sex offender registry  
- DE is hereby ordered in the above-captioned case, that he have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons C.C.H..  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  
- DE is ordered to no contact with any minors under the age of 18
- DE is ordered to supervised visits with m.f & j.f.
- Restitution is ordered if any and must be determined in 60 days
- Court costs of $268.00 and DNA Surcharge of $250.00
- Court orders the DE remanded into the custody of the St. Croix County Sheriff's Department for transportation to Dodge.  
- 20 days to appeal
Filed by Atty Bartholomew. Re: attached letter on behalf of Def. km
Filed by C. Hearthfield. Re: case. km
Sentencing hearing on June 29, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Reviewed by EJL. km
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kenneth Sortedahl, DF ATTY: James Robert Bartholomew, DF: Jay Patrick Flaherty appeared.  Court called at 2:38 p.m.  Set for STC.  Attorney Bartholomew advises there is a preliminary resolution with the State.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the court.  There still needs to be a PSI done for the DE.  ADA Sortedahl recites the agreement.  Court questions the DE.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 2.  Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE adjudicated guilty of Ct 2.  On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 1. Bail is vacated.  Sentencing will be scheduled after PSI is completed.  Court adjourned  2:56 p.m. lw
on behalf of def. EJL reviewed. cc: DA and Atty

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox,ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl DF ATTY:  James Robert Bartholomew DF: Jay Patrick Flaherty appeared from jail. Case called at 10:33. ADA Sortedahl updates court as to recording time started at 1 hr 10 min. Ex. #1 (meeting at the school) and #2 (recording of interview with detective) #3 (diagram of the PD) O/R. S/T Detective Craig Yehlik. Direct by ADA Sortedahl. Cross by Atty. J. Bartholomew. Re-Direct by ADA K. Sortedahl. Atty. Bartholomew makes statement regarding motions previously filed. ADA K. Sortedahl makes statement as to the custodial aspect, there will be a brief drafted on this topic.  Atty. Bartholomew makes a statement. Court orders transcript from a private source. Cost will be the county's through the Clerk of Courts Office. From Reciept of the transcript Atty. Bartholomew has 10 days and 10 further days further for ADA Sortedahls response and 5 days thereafter for Atty. Bartholomew. Written decision. Bail continues.  Status conference scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:   Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY:  James Robert Bartholomew, DF:  Jay Patrick Flaherty appeared from jail. Set for a preliminary hearing. Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing.  Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. Bond continues. State files an INFO. Court proceeds to ARGN. Same appearances. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  Defendant enters a not guilty plea on both counts. Waives speedy trial. Attorney Bartholomew argument re: bond modification. ADA Sortedahl objects to a bond modification. Court does not amend bond at this time. Speedy trial is waived. Atty Bartholomew requests time to file motions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 21, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Filed by Assistant District Attorney Ken Sortedahl.
Preliminary hearing on October 9, 2014 at 10:30 am.
